alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 5:57AM AKST until January 22 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW FROM PELICAN TO JUNEAU FOR SUNDAY INTO MONDAY... .A heavy band of snow from a stationary front looks to set up from Pelican to Juneau Sunday through Monday, with the greatest rates Sunday night through Monday. Resilient cold air from the north is expected to remain in place through much of the event, keeping precipitation as snow. Moisture transport appears to hit Juneau the hardest, prompting the highest snow totals. At this time, snow looks to fully transition to a wintry mix and rain early Tuesday morning. However, this transition will depend on how fast the incoming front can break through the cold air. It is possible that this event will be long duration. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches. * WHERE...Gustavus, Hoonah, Tenakee Springs, and Pelican. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 3 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
